DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen PAXgene Blood RNA Tube Standard Operating Procedure Collection and Storage Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the PAXgene Blood RNA specimen was collected and stored in accordance with the specified SOP.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen PAXgene Blood RNA Tube Standard Operating Procedure Collection And Storage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
